movies.Title: The Shawshank Redemption
movies.Writer: Stephen King (short story "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption"), Frank Darabont (screenplay)
movies.Actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
movies.Plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
movies.Awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 19 wins & 32 nominations.

movies.Title: The Godfather
movies.Writer: Mario Puzo (screenplay by), Francis Ford Coppola (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (based on the novel by)
movies.Actors: Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Richard S. Castellano
movies.Plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

movies.Title: The Godfather: Part II
movies.Writer: Francis Ford Coppola (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (based on the novel by)
movies.Actors: Al Pacino, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Robert De Niro
movies.Plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

movies.Title: The Dark Knight
movies.Writer: Jonathan Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (story), David S. Goyer (story), Bob Kane (characters)
movies.Actors: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Caine
movies.Plot: When the menace known as the Joker emerges from his mysterious past, he wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham. The Dark Knight must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

movies.Title: 12 Angry Men
movies.Actors: Martin Balsam, John Fiedler, Lee J. Cobb, E.G. Marshall
movies.Plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
movies.Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 8 nominations.

movies.Title: Schindler's List
movies.Actors: Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley, Ralph Fiennes, Caroline Goodall
movies.Plot: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazi Germans.

movies.Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
movies.Writer: J.R.R. Tolkien (novel), Fran Walsh (screenplay), Philippa Boyens (screenplay), Peter Jackson (screenplay)
movies.Actors: Noel Appleby, Ali Astin, Sean Astin, David Aston
movies.Plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

movies.Title: Pulp Fiction
movies.Writer: Quentin Tarantino (stories), Roger Avary (stories), Quentin Tarantino
movies.Actors: Tim Roth, Amanda Plummer, Laura Lovelace, John Travolta
movies.Plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

movies.Title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
movies.Writer: Luciano Vincenzoni (story), Sergio Leone (story), Agenore Incrocci (screenplay), Furio Scarpelli (screenplay), Luciano Vincenzoni (screenplay), Sergio Leone (screenplay)
movies.Actors: Eli Wallach, Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Aldo Giuffr√®
movies.Plot: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

movies.Title: Fight Club
movies.Actors: Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Meat Loaf, Zach Grenier
movies.Plot: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
movies.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 34 nominations.
